I'm recently trying to get myself back into community building and this time with citizen science! In the last two and half years, my voluteering lead to citizen science as my work is for Grailville. Since Grailville is not tied to an academic institution or a research institution, my work is considered to be under the citizen science umbrella although I worked solo on it.

Before this post, I was only aware of Mozilla Science Lab (MSL), Public Lab, and Zooniverse. After asking around on the Center for Open Science Framework, I found about the Citizen Science Association.

The first seven are coming from when I was active in the Ubuntu Community and the last two are from what I seen used in Open Science communities, mainly from Mozilla Science Lab and Public Lab.

Wiki

Wikis are one of the best infrastructures for any Open * community. They allow the most collaboration because anyone, with an account, can create and edit pages. These pages can be member profiles or pages that relate to teams and/or projects.
